newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila call money unchanged on steady C Bank rate.
newsitem.headline: Manila call money unchanged on steady C Bank rate.

text.p: Manila overnight money stood firm on Friday as the Central Bank kept a floor on short-term rates through its 18 percent overnight borrowing rate, traders said.

The Central Bank slashed its key rate on Thursday by two percentage points after the foreign exchange market calmed down in recent days. The peso was hit by speculation last week from the backlash of the Thai baht problems.
The average rate stood at 18.03125 percent as volume fell to 12.35 billion pesos from 13.55 billion. The market had 31 lenders and 17 borrowers.
Meanwhile, banks continued to stay away from the secondary Treasury bill market as they adopted a wait-and-see attitude on the direction of rates.
"It was too quiet," a dealer said.
"Banks are still wary. Anytime, there could be a return of speculative attack on the region's financial markets," another trader said.
A Reuter poll of seven financial institutions gave bid rates of 11/11.25 percent and offers of 10.80/11.15 for the three-month bills.
